Pre-Game Insights: Wales are now unbeaten in seven – only once have they recorded a longer streak without defeat under Rob Page (nine games between September 2021 and March 2022 – W4 D5).
Robert Lewandowski has been directly involved in 24 goals in his last 27 appearances for Poland (16 goals, eight assists), although he’s not scored in any of his three games against Wales to date.
Wales have only lost one of their last 15 Euro qualifiers played at the Cardiff City Stadium (W10 D4).
Poland have lost three of their four Euro qualifier matches played away from home since the start of 2023 (W1).
Robert Lewandowski has not scored in any of his three previous games against Wales.
Harry Wilson has six goal involvements in nine Euro 2024 qualifying appearances (three goals, three assists) – the most of any Welsh player in the qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales and Poland have faced each other on 10 previous occasions, with Wales winning only once in their first meeting back in March 1973 (2-0).
Poland have won each of their last three away games against Wales in competitive action.
The Opta supercomputer suggests Wales are slight favorites with a 40.4% chance of winning inside 90 minutes compared to Poland’s 30.8% chance.
